An Oakleyman Song
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Library: Fan Fiction, Poetry, Birthday List, Links & Non-Fiction Archive: Filk Songs: An Oakleyman Song
By Lisa Shock on Wednesday, September 27, 2000 - 11:57 pm:

This song is to the tune of "If You Wanna Be Happy" by Jimmy Soul ©May 1963 Le Grand - S.P.Q.R Records.


If you wanna be happy for the rest of your life
Never make Oakleyman Part of your strife
From my personal point of view
Skip a level or two!

(Repeat)

Oakleyman's talents make everyone look small
And very often cause your downfall
As soon as you battle him, then he starts
To do things to rip you apart!

But if you avoid all of his tricks and strife
A-you'll be happy for the rest of your life
Any other battle can be easy and true
If you simply just follow through!

(Repeat verse one)

Spoken:
Say Man!
Hey rancher!
I saw Oakleyman the other day!
Yeah?
Boy is he tricky!
Yeah, but jus' stay outta his way!

(Repeat verse 1 a few times)

Fade out

This pretty much follows the patterns of the original song. Hope you like it!

By CHB on Thursday, September 28, 2000 - 04:48 pm:

MWAHAHAAA! I did have quite a few problems with Ordorf, but not Oakleyman. This must be a warning for begining trainers. I skip E rank now and dive into D. However, Ordorf has been beaten by my last three monsters. A Battle Rocks, a Wracky, and a Chariot. The Chariot also did much more....

By Lisa Shock on Thursday, September 28, 2000 - 09:41 pm:

I started to play Monster Farm 2 recently. It was interesting to start from scratch with little money, and only a vague idea what was being said to me! That Oakleyman made my poor japanese Mocchi's life pure torment!

By Eagle Fierce on Friday, September 29, 2000 - 03:31 pm:

You don't HAVE to skip E class, if you don't want to battle Oakleyman. Simply bring your monster's highest stat acquisition (usually pow or int) to approximately 500 or so, and he'll totally wimp out! Since it is always best to train for two years before battling, anyways, it isn't difficult to get an offensive stat that high, and it's worth it if you want to skip Oakleyman. Personally, I just learned his pattern and tore him a new...err...I tore it one! ^_^

By Farmer Jimbo on Friday, September 29, 2000 - 04:11 pm:

Oooh, you will keep us updated on MF2 right?

By Carl Carlisle on Wednesday, November 29, 2000 - 11:26 pm:

You're playing a Japanese version? If so, are you able to do it on a u.s. Playstation?

By Lisa Shock on Thursday, November 30, 2000 - 08:36 am:

Nope, there are territorial lockouts, you can't play Japanese or European games on a US PSX, unless you modify it which is illegal or get an adapter that ONLY fits the original PSXs with all the ports on the back, and those recently became illegal as well. (Plus, most stores stopped carrying them when Sony stopped putting the serial port on PSXs two years ago.)

Tronix, linked in the Library Links section, carrys import sytems and games.
